document.docAuthor: Sigwart, Julia D. & Sirenko, Boris I.
document.masterDocTitle: Deep-sea chitons from sunken wood in the West Pacific (Mollusca: Polyplacophora: Lepidopleurida): taxonomy, distribution, and seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Deep-sea chitons from sunken wood in the West Pacific (Mollusca: Polyplacophora: Lepidopleurida): taxonomy, distribution, and seven new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Chresonymy and synonymy from
Sigwart ( 2009 b)
. Records reported before 2009 without illustration are all assumed to refer to
N. lineata
s.s.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Lepidopleurus lineatus
lectotype (ITZ Moll. 3.05.011) designated by
Ferreira ( 1979 : 163 )
;
Lepidopleurus belknapioides
holotype ( MNHN 5862 ).
84 specimens
in 18 lots from Vanuatu ,
125 specimens
in 29 lots from the Philippines ,
263 specimens
in 36 lots from the Solomon Islands .

Distribution. Widely distributed in the Western Pacific, in Japan , Philippines , Solomon Islands , Indonesia , Vanuatu (summarised in
Kaas & Van Belle 1985
; see also
Sigwart 2009 b
); 121–1767 m . Material studied here represents the deepest records for the species, from the Philippines at 1750–1767 m (Panglao 2005 sta. CP 2353 ) and 1764 m (Panglao 2005 sta. CP 2356 ). Locally abundant species and common on sunken wood.
